Hello, I have an dynamic page with CRM object content where featured image not showing up when sharing on social media. Featured image in settings are set to the right object property but when debugging on Facebook it says that the page doesn't contain a og:image metatag

Hi everyone. I am hoping someone can help me with an issue I am having. I have a third party who is looking to share contact data through an API into a HubSpot form I have created. They have mapped the properties and are posting the data to a URL which holds only the form. When submitting they are getting a 'Request Forbidden' response. Any ideas on how to fix this/manage it in a simpler way (I don't currently have CMS hub and am not sure if there are any IP restrictions)? Further to this is there a way to set up a key authorisation? Thanks!

Hi everyone, I have a question.
We have an app called "Contract creation" that is basically a webhook that send HubSpot deal id to dovetail webaddress.
The app works as intended.
What I want to do is create a card in "deals" with a button to retrigger the application and deal id is sent again to dovetail.
Here :arrow_down: is where Id like to have the card with the "retrigger" button.
If anyone got an idea on how to do it, I'd appreciate it a lot.
Thanks in advance

Hi all,
I'm trying to bulk update Contacts through the API using 'idProperty'=>'email'  without success.  I'm using the PHP library. If I do the update with regular ids it works, but with 'idProperty' I get an error message 'Could not get some CONTACT objects, they may be deleted or not exist. Check that ids are valid.' I tried rearranging the input and moving around 'idProperty' as I don't know which is the right syntax, but none worked for me.
```$inputs = [
    ["idProperty" => "email", "id"=>"<mailto:xxxx@example.com|xxxx@example.com>", "properties" => ["evt_test"=>true]]
];
$BatchInputSimplePublicObjectBatchInput = new BatchInputSimplePublicObjectBatchInput(['inputs' => $inputs]);```
Please help! :worried: Thank you!
